column3: utACK d302879. Tagged for future release (0.13.1)\n
I just realized that this may be intentional, as we perhaps still do accept sub-minrelayfee transactions ("free transactions") before the mempool fills up?\n
Correct. If we stopped handling free transactions, quite a lot of code would simplify/can be deleted.\n

I think this patch passes the extended rpc test suite. This reminds me that a small test (maybe for the extended suite) could be helpful to check that priority transactions don't break accidentally.\n
Closing. Apparently, we need tests for priority or remove it, but this should be done in a separate pull.\n
